s338: Sixteenth. Arrived in Guanzhong, executed Qin prince Ziying, massacred and burned Xianyang. Divided the empire, established the lords.
s339: Twenty-fifth. Divided Zhao into Dai state.
s340: Eighteenth. Xiang Yu resented Rong, divided Qi into three states.
s341: Twenty-ninth. Had a falling out with Xiang Yu, met him below Xi, reconciled. Yu broke the agreement, divided Guanzhong into four states.
s342: Twenty-ninth. Zang Tu followed and entered, divided Yan into two states.
s343: Seventeenth. Divided Wei into Yin state.
s344: Twentieth. Divided Han into Henan state.
s367: Ninth. Yi Di first year. The lords honored Huai Wang as Yi Di.
s368: Seventeenth. Xiang Ji established himself as Western Chu Overlord.
s377: First month. Divided Guanzhong into Han.
s388: Second. Moved capital to Chenzhou south of the Jiang.
s389: Western Chu lorded over the dukes, Xiang Ji beginning, commanded the empire's fate, controlled eighteen kings.
s390: King Wu Rui beginning, former Fan lord.
s391: King Gong Ao beginning, former Chu Zhu Guo.
s392: King Ying Bu beginning, former Chu general.
s393: King Zhang Er beginning, former Chu general.
s394: Twenty-seventh. King Zhao Xie beginning, former Zhao king.
s395: King Tian Du beginning, former Qi general.
s396: King Tian An beginning, former Qi general.
s397: Twentieth. King Tian Shi beginning, former Qi king.
s398: Second month. Han King beginning, former Pei Gong.
s399: King Zhang Han beginning, former Qin general.
s400: King Sima Xin beginning, former Qin general.
s401: King Dong Yi beginning, former Qin general.
s402: King Zang Tu beginning, former Yan general.
s403: Thirty-first. King Han Guang beginning, former Yan king.
s404: Nineteenth. King Wei Bao beginning, former Wei king.
s405: King Sima Ang beginning, former Zhao general.
s406: Twenty-second. King Han Cheng beginning, former Han general.
